Dr. Tamara Gierke

Dr. Tamara Gierke graduated from Ball State University in 1994 with a B.S. in Chemistry and continued graduate studies at Ball State earning an M.A in 1995. While at Ball State, Dr. Gierke was on an athletic scholarship for swimming. After working in various capacities as a chemist, she attended Indiana University School of Dentistry and graduated in 2005 with a Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) degree.

Dr. Gierke continued her training at Riley Hospital for Children completing a two year residency in pediatric dentistry earning an MSD degree. After graduation in 2007, Dr. Gierke worked in a public health dental clinic in Bangor, Maine setting up their pediatric dentistry program. In 2008 she joined Bloomington Pediatric Dentistry and in 2011 became a partner in the practice. Dr. Gierke is a member of various pediatric dentistry organizations, an Associate Professor of Clinical Pediatric Dentistry at Riley Hospital for Children in Indianapolis, and is a Board Eligible candidate of the American Board of Pediatric Dentistry.

Dr. Gierke holds hospital privileges at Riley Hospital for Children in Indianapolis, Indiana University Health Bloomington Hospital, and the Southern Indiana Surgery Center. Dr. Gierke lives in Bloomington with her husband Dan. They are outdoor enthusiasts and spend as much time as possible on Lake Monroe whether itâ€™s canoeing, swimming, pontooning, or snow shoeing! They also love to travel and spend time with their family and friends all over the world!
